## Course Description

This course introduces students to the fundamental methods used in political science research. Students will learn both quantitative and qualitative approaches to studying political phenomena.

## Learning Objectives

By the end of this course, students will be able to:

1. Understand the scientific method as applied to political science
2. Design and evaluate research questions
3. Distinguish between various research methodologies
4. Analyze and interpret political data using R
5. Critically evaluate political science research

## Required Materials

- **Textbook:** Research Methods in Political Science (8th Edition)
- **Software:** R and RStudio (free download)
- **Additional readings:** Available on course website

## Course Schedule

### Week 1-2: Introduction to Research Methods
- What is political science research?
- The scientific method
- Research questions and hypotheses

### Week 3-4: Research Design
- Experimental vs. observational studies
- Qualitative research methods
- Case studies and comparative analysis

### Week 5-6: Quantitative Methods
- Introduction to statistics
- Descriptive statistics
- Data visualization

### Week 7-8: Introduction to R
- R basics and RStudio
- Data manipulation
- Basic programming concepts

### Week 9-10: Data Analysis
- Hypothesis testing
- Correlation and regression
- Interpreting results

### Week 11-12: Advanced Topics
- Survey research
- Content analysis
- Ethics in political research

### Week 13-14: Final Projects
- Student presentations
- Peer review
